Package nz.ac.auckland.integration.testing.expectation

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AsyncMockExpectation
    An expectation that an asynchronous message will be received at some point in the future.
    AsyncMockExpectation.Builder  
    ContentMockExpectation
    An abstract class to set expectations for bodies and headers for an incoming message

    This class carries out the message validation based on the test resource, expectations will be returned in the order specified even if some relaxation of total ordering occurs
    ContentMockExpectation.AbstractContentBuilder<Product extends MockExpectation,Builder extends MockExpectation.AbstractBuilder<Product,Builder>>  
    ExceptionMockExpectation
    This endpoint will throw an exception of the specified type back to the message consumer; this is likely to cause transaction rollback or some kind of SOAP fault

    If no exception is specified then an empty Exception is thrown
    ExceptionMockExpectation.Builder  
    HttpErrorMockExpectation
    This will cause a Jetty or CXF endpoint (message consumer) to throw an HTTP 500 (or other) error with the specified body - this could be a SOAP fault message in the case of a web-service

    It is recommended to use SoapFaultMockExpectation if you want to throw correct CXF SOAP Faults
    HttpErrorMockExpectation.Builder  
    MockExpectation
    A general class for specifying an expectation for a consumer of the given endpoint URI.
    MockExpectation.AbstractBuilder<Product extends MockExpectation,Builder extends MockExpectation.AbstractBuilder<Product,Builder>>  
    SoapFaultMockExpectation
    This will cause a CXF endpoint (message consumer) to return a specified SOAP fault back to the consumer
    SoapFaultMockExpectation.Builder  
    SyncMockExpectation
    An expectation that provides a message response back to the message consumer
    SyncMockExpectation.Builder  
    SyncMockExpectation.Init<Product,Builder extends SyncMockExpectation.Init<Product,Builder,T>,T extends TestResource>  
    UnreceivedMockExpectation
    An expectation for ensuring that no message is expected to arrive at an endpoint.
    UnreceivedMockExpectation.Builder  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    MockExpectation.OrderingType
